title: Portfolio Website
description:
"What is the best way to show your stuff? A website!"

I wanted to make one that showed my work front and centre but as cheaply as possible so I decided to make it myself and found it was a good opportunity to learn something new.

Using only HTML/CSS/JavaScript, I was able to achieve dynamically loaded content for future additions and fully mobile friendly, all hosted for free on GitHub.

Let me know what you think!

title: Corporate
description:
My role doesn't require me to do any software development but as I've got programming experience, I found some of the responsibilities I had could be automated by writing software.

One such task was access provisioning. It required the use of SailPointâ€™s Identity Now, which when it comes to provisioning multiple roles at a time, is very repetitive and slow. The major problem I faced was not having access to the site itself as I was not part of the application team and the restrictions around it. I got around this by utilising Selenium, allowing me to create a program that interacted with the website and doing the task for me in quick succession, saving hours of work (and headache).

Others included writing email based macros in excel for quick and easy data extraction / sending.

(Unfortunately I am unable to link to the source for security reasons)

title: Fireborn Menu System
description:
After the fun we had during the global game jam and the demonstration of my knowledge in Unreal Engine, Tyson from Toybox Games contracted me to build a menu system for Fireborn to use during their PAX Australia showcase.

It took around two weeks to complete and integrate with features such as: keyboard/controller support, settings, designer customisable elements, nice animations, and session persistency.

I built it in blueprints and provided documentation for use by the designer.

I've linked to an independent project as the game is still unreleased (under NDA but posted with permission).

title: Melbourne GGJ 2019
description:
Working with a team formed at the IGDA Melbourne meeting, we set out to make a homey feeling game set in the Australian outback. You traverse the beautiful Northern Territory as a Wedge Tail Eagle, hunting to feed your chicks.

I was in charge of the player character and the game loop, implementing a flight movement controller that could pick up prey and return them to it's nest.

title: University
description:
There were a myriad of projects completed during my time at university. An unforgiving platformer, a game a week for 10 weeks, a Microsoft Hololens application, a game jam and more.

While mainly a programmer for all of them, I also took on the role of a designer, a producer and an artist during development.

The video informs of my role in each project and I've linked them below to try/inspect.
